Squarespace AI for Roofers

Squarespace dominates for roofing contractors because their before/after gallery templates are built for visual proof. The "projects" section creates dramatic transformations that sell your work instantly. Quote request forms integrate seamlessly. Mobile responsiveness is excellent - critical when homeowners search during storms. SSL included = trust. Performance is solid (80-90 PageSpeed) - not the fastest but acceptable. The contractor-specific templates understand what roofers need: visible credentials, emergency contact, service areas, project showcase.

Best for:

Roofers who want stunning project galleries with minimal effort, professional templates that build trust immediately, integrated quote forms that capture storm damage leads fast. If you prioritize visual proof and easy mobile quote capture, Squarespace wins.

Watch out for:

Template limits - you can't customize everything. Monthly commitment - no annual savings compared to some. Less flexibility for complex service area pages (franchises, multi-location). Performance is good but not great - if PageSpeed is your top priority, Webflow beats it.

Phoenix roofer went from invisible to 247 monthly quote requests in 90 days using Squarespace. Before/after gallery with 87 transformations, emergency click-to-call, visible credentials, service area map, mobile-optimized quote form. Result: 214% revenue increase, $468,000 in 90 days, 6,225% ROI. Squarespace delivered the visual credibility + mobile quote capture that storm damage searches demand.

Wix AI for Roofers

Wix excels for emergency quote capture. Their contractor templates include built-in emergency contact forms that work. Easy scheduling for roof inspections - homeowners can book directly after storms. Mobile app makes updates from job sites easy. Template variety is massive - you'll find roofing-specific designs. However, performance issues are real - many Wix sites score 60-75 PageSpeed. Template lock-in means switching later = rebuild. Monthly pricing adds up compared to annual plans elsewhere.

Best for:

Roofers who want easy emergency quote forms, inspection scheduling built-in, contractor templates that work out of the box. If you prioritize ease of use and emergency lead capture over raw performance, Wix works.

Watch out for:

Performance issues - expect 60-75 PageSpeed scores. Template lock-in - changing templates later = complete rebuild. Monthly pricing only - no annual savings. Ad-heavy editor interface can be confusing. If performance matters for Google rankings, Wix may hurt.

Webflow AI for Roofers

Webflow delivers the best performance (95+ PageSpeed) and complete customization. Perfect for roofing companies with complex needs - franchises, multi-location, custom service area pages. CMS power lets you manage 100+ projects easily. Export capability = you own the code. However, learning curve is steep - expect 2-3 days to build properly. Requires technical comfort or hiring a Webflow designer. Setup time is longer. If you need it fast, Webflow frustrates. If you need it perfect and performant, Webflow wins.

Best for:

Roofers with technical skills or budget for Webflow designer, multi-location franchises, complex service area needs, performance-critical SEO strategies. If you need 95+ PageSpeed and full control, Webflow is unmatched.

Watch out for:

Learning curve - if you're not technical, this will frustrate. Build time - expect 2-3 days minimum. Ongoing maintenance - updates require technical comfort. Template ecosystem is smaller than Wix/Squarespace. If you want "easy," Webflow isn't it.

Real example:

Multi-state roofing franchise used Webflow for custom service area pages (50+ cities). Built complex CMS for 200+ projects across locations. PageSpeed 97. SEO rankings #1-3 for "roofing [city]" across 40+ markets. Cost: $8,000 (Webflow designer build). ROI: 6 months. Traffic increased 340%, quote requests 287%. Perfect for franchises with technical resources. Overkill for single-location roofers who need it fast.

FAQ: Roofing Websites

Do roofers really need a website?

Yes. 79% of homeowners search online for roofing contractors, especially during storm damage emergencies. No website = invisible when they need you NOW. Your competitors with sites get the calls. You get nothing. Storm damage waits for nobody. Make yourself findable.

How many project photos should I show?

Minimum 50. Aim for 100+. Before/after transformations sell your work. Storm damage to brand new roof = proof = trust = hire you. Drone footage adds credibility. Video testimonials from homeowners add authenticity. More proof = more quotes.

Should I show my license number?

Yes, prominently above fold. "Fully Licensed & Insured - $2M Coverage - License #XXXXX" visible instantly. 53% more trust when credentials are visible. Homeowners hire legitimate contractors who prove it. Hide your license = they assume you're not legitimate.

How important is mobile for roofing websites?

Critical. 79% of roofing searches happen on phones. Storm damage = homeowner searches outside with phone, water dripping. Non-responsive site = they call someone else. Mobile-optimized quote form = they request immediately. Emergency = mobile search = mobile site = you get the job.

What about emergency contact visibility?

Make it prominent. "24/7 Emergency Roof Repair - Storm Damage" with click-to-call above fold. Storm damage happens NOW. Homeowner with leak at 2 AM searches, calls first roofer with visible emergency number. That's not you if it's buried. Emergency visible = hired.

How long does it take to see results?

Phoenix roofer saw 5x more quotes month 1 (134 vs 27 before), 214% revenue increase in 90 days. Before/after gallery + emergency visibility + mobile optimization = immediate results. SEO rankings build over 2-3 months. Emergency inquiries start immediately.
